solution.text:
In the given data, there are a total of _{{j+k+l}}_ women surveyed.
Of that number, _{j}_ women stated that Sports was their favourite hobby.

We know that
\(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)

Therefore the Probability of the Event, P(E), of having sports as a favourite hobby is : \(\frac{_{j}_}{_{{j+k+l}}_}\) = \(_{{trunc((Decimal(j)/(j+k+l)),3)}}_\)

content.text:
_{{j+k+l}}_ young women between the ages of _{n}_ and _{o}_ were selected randomly in the city of Mumbai and asked what their favourite hobby was. The following data was recorded:

HobbyNumber
Sports_{j}_
Art/Dance_{k}_
Reading_{l}_
Compute the probability of an individual from the group whose favourite hobby is Sports (Enter the answer as a decimal and round off after 3 decimal places if necessary)
